bibl.title: How Power and Province Communicate: Some Remarks on the Language of the (Non-)Conversation between Pilate and Jesus.
bibl.note: [Introduction.] - Provincial Language: How Much Greek Could an Average Galilean Speak? [see pp. 170-172: Galilee in the Hellenistic Period. Text and translation of P. Col. Zenon I, 2.] - Powerful Language: Exclusion of the Other [with evidence from Greek papyri]. - Who's Powerful and Who's Powerless? - Conclusion.

bibl.title: Light from the East. Papyrologische Kommentare zum Neuen Testament. Akten des internationalen Symposions vom 3.-4. Dezember 2009 am Fachbereich Bibelwissenschaft und Kirchengeschichte der Universität Salzburg

bibl.seg: KREINECKER Christina M., How Power and Province Communicate: Some Remarks on the Language of the (Non-)Conversation between Pilate and Jesus.

Peter ARZT-GRABNER und Christina M. KREINECKER (Hgg.), Light from the East. Papyrologische Kommentare zum Neuen Testament. Akten des internationalen Symposions vom 3.-4. Dezember 2009 am Fachbereich Bibelwissenschaft und Kirchengeschichte der Universität Salzburg = Philippika. Marburger altertumskundliche Abhandlungen. 39 (Wiesbaden, 2010) pp. 169-185.

[Introduction.] - Provincial Language: How Much Greek Could an Average Galilean Speak? [see pp. 170-172: Galilee in the Hellenistic Period. Text and translation of P. Col. Zenon I, 2.] - Powerful Language: Exclusion of the Other [with evidence from Greek papyri]. - Who's Powerful and Who's Powerless? - Conclusion.
